alert.note: Alert for Prince George (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 7:01PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Prince George County, the City of Hopewell and the City of Petersburg through 745 PM EDT... At 701 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Prince George, or near Fort Lee, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain could result in ponding of water on roadways in low lying and poor drainage areas. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Disputanta around 725 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include New Bohemia, Richard Bland College, Templeton, Birchett Estate, Petersburg National Battlefield and Prince George Golf. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
